page.title: 05SOPLEY CHURCH
page.content: The parish church of{Saint Michael {and All Angels}stands on a mound leading up from the{River Avon.}There has almost certainly been a church or chapel on this site since Saxon times. The entry made for{Sopley}in the{Domesday Book}of 1086 referred only to the{mill}which stands a few yards to the south. It is not unusual however to find that a place of worship was omitted from the survey and the popular belief is that the Saxons would certainly have worshiped here. The present church is built of{Iron bearing rock quarried locally at{ {Hengistbury Head,}this gives the church its attractive multi_coloured appearance. { { ***** SEE PHOTOGRAPH *****
